intro: Laxmannia potentilloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. Laxmannia potentilloides is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for xerophytic gardens.
